bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Richard Croom Beatty (1905-1961) professor and writer, usually associated with Vanderbilt University, Nashville, Tennessee, was the author of biographies of Bayard Taylor (1936), Lord Macaulay (1938), and James Russell Lowell (1942); edited The American Tradition in Literature (1957); also wrote poetry, articles and reviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with publishers and friends, manuscripts of articles, poems, books, reviews, and other writings, notes, teaching notebooks, term papers, clippings, printed materials, and photographs. Includes translation from the German version of William Byrd's Natural History of Virginia, which Beatty edited and published. Correspondents include Stringfellow Barr, Louise Cowan, Wilbur Cross, Harold M. Jones, Merrill Moore, Jesse Stuart and R.M. Weaver. Also donated were approximately 215 books, the majority about or by southern writers, especially Tennesseeans. Some of the volumes are inscribed by the authors to Beatty. The majority of Beatty's own works are in the collection and autographed. A list of the titles donated is included at the end of the guide.
